trend_continuation_patterns.name: ascending_triangle
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Flat resistance on top, rising lows (higher lows) below.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Forms during an uptrend as a consolidation.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Breakout is usually above the horizontal resistance; volume expansion helps confirm.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: descending_triangle
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Flat support below, falling highs (lower highs) above.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Forms during a downtrend as a consolidation.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Breakout is usually below the horizontal support; watch for increased selling volume.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: symmetrical_triangle
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Converging trendlines with lower highs and higher lows.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Consolidation after a prior trend (up or down).
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Can break either way; prior trend bias plus volume and momentum help gauge direction.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: bull_flag
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Strong vertical up move (flagpole), followed by a small downward or sideways channel.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Occurs after a sharp rally in an uptrend.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Breakout typically resumes the prior sharp move; shallow pullbacks are common.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: bear_flag
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Strong vertical down move, followed by a small upward or sideways channel.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Occurs after a sharp selloff in a downtrend.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Breakdown usually resumes the prior sharp decline.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: bullish_pennant
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Sharp up move followed by a small, converging triangle-like consolidation.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Appears after a strong bullish impulse.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Similar to a bull flag but with converging trendlines.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: bearish_pennant
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Sharp down move followed by a small, converging consolidation.
trend_continuation_patterns.typical_context: Appears after a strong bearish impulse.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Similar to a bear flag but with converging trendlines.

trend_continuation_patterns.name: rectangle_range_in_trend
trend_continuation_patterns.look: Horizontal support and resistance; price oscillates between them.
trend_continuation_patterns.notes: Breaks can occur either way; prior trend gives a bias.

reversal_patterns.name: head_and_shoulders_top
reversal_patterns.look: Three peaks: the middle (head) higher than the two shoulders; neckline connects the swing lows.
reversal_patterns.typical_context: Forms after an uptrend, signaling potential top.
reversal_patterns.notes: Breakdown below neckline is the trigger; volume often increases on the breakdown.

reversal_patterns.name: inverse_head_and_shoulders_bottom
reversal_patterns.look: Three troughs: the middle (head) lower than the two shoulders; neckline connects the swing highs.
reversal_patterns.typical_context: Forms after a downtrend, signaling potential bottom.
reversal_patterns.notes: Breakout above neckline is the trigger; often used to project upside targets.

reversal_patterns.name: double_top
reversal_patterns.look: Two peaks at a similar price level with a pullback in between.
reversal_patterns.notes: Confirmation usually comes when price breaks below the support between the peaks.

reversal_patterns.name: double_bottom
reversal_patterns.look: Two troughs at a similar price level with a bounce in between.
reversal_patterns.notes: Confirmation usually comes when price breaks above the resistance between the lows.

reversal_patterns.name: triple_top
reversal_patterns.look: Three peaks at a similar price level.
reversal_patterns.notes: Breakdown below the common support level confirms the pattern.

reversal_patterns.name: triple_bottom
reversal_patterns.look: Three troughs at a similar price level.
reversal_patterns.notes: Breakout above the common resistance level confirms the pattern.

reversal_patterns.name: rising_wedge
reversal_patterns.look: Price rises within converging, upward-sloping trendlines.
reversal_patterns.typical_context: Can appear in uptrends or as a corrective move in downtrends.
reversal_patterns.notes: Often a bearish pattern even though price is rising; breakdown below lower trendline is watched.

reversal_patterns.name: falling_wedge
reversal_patterns.look: Price falls within converging, downward-sloping trendlines.
reversal_patterns.typical_context: Can appear in downtrends or as a corrective move in uptrends.
reversal_patterns.notes: Often a bullish pattern even though price is falling; breakout above upper trendline is watched.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: bullish_engulfing
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: A small bearish (down) candle followed by a larger bullish (up) candle that fully engulfs the prior body.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.typical_context: After a decline or at support.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Signals potential upside reversal; strength increases with higher volume and strong close.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: bearish_engulfing
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: A small bullish (up) candle followed by a larger bearish (down) candle that fully engulfs the prior body.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.typical_context: After a rally or at resistance.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Signals potential downside reversal; stronger when near resistance or after extended up move.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: hammer
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: Small real body near the top of the range, long lower shadow, little to no upper shadow.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.typical_context: After a decline, often at or near support.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Shows intraday rejection of lower prices; confirmation often requires a bullish candle afterward.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: shooting_star
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: Small real body near the bottom of the range, long upper shadow, little to no lower shadow.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.typical_context: After a rally, often near resistance.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Shows rejection of higher prices; confirmation usually with a subsequent bearish candle.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: morning_star
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: Three-candle pattern: large down candle, small indecisive candle (doji/spinning top), then large up candle.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Classic bullish reversal; third candle closing well into the first candle’s body adds strength.

candlestick_reversal_patterns.name: evening_star
candlestick_reversal_patterns.look: Three-candle pattern: large up candle, small indecisive candle, then large down candle.
candlestick_reversal_patterns.notes: Classic bearish reversal; third candle closing well into the first candle’s body adds strength.

channel_patterns.name: ascending_channel
channel_patterns.look: Price oscillates between two roughly parallel upward-sloping trendlines (higher highs and higher lows).
channel_patterns.notes: As long as price stays within the channel, trend is intact. A decisive break above can signal acceleration, a break below often signals trend weakening or reversal.

channel_patterns.name: descending_channel
channel_patterns.look: Price oscillates between two roughly parallel downward-sloping trendlines (lower highs and lower lows).
channel_patterns.notes: Staying within the channel confirms the downtrend. A strong breakout above the upper boundary can signal a trend reversal or major short-covering rally.

channel_patterns.name: horizontal_channel_range
channel_patterns.look: Price trades between nearly flat parallel support and resistance lines.
channel_patterns.typical_context: Sideways markets, accumulation or distribution phases.
channel_patterns.notes: Direction often depends on prior trend (range after an uptrend often breaks up; after a downtrend often breaks down). Volume and false breaks give additional clues.

channel_patterns.name: channel_breakout_above
channel_patterns.look: Price closes above the upper boundary of an ascending, descending, or horizontal channel.
channel_patterns.typical_context: End of consolidation in a channel or acceleration of an existing uptrend.
channel_patterns.notes: In an ascending channel, this may signal acceleration; in a descending or sideways channel, it often signals trend reversal. Confirmation via volume and follow-through is important.

channel_patterns.name: channel_breakdown_below
channel_patterns.look: Price closes below the lower boundary of an ascending, descending, or horizontal channel.
channel_patterns.typical_context: End of consolidation or exhaustion of an uptrend.
channel_patterns.notes: In an ascending or sideways channel this often signals trend reversal or deeper correction; in a descending channel it can signal acceleration of the downtrend.

support_resistance_breakout_patterns.name: breakout_above_resistance
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.look: Price moves and closes above a previously established resistance level.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.typical_context: After consolidation or at the end of a base.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.notes: Higher volume and strong close above the level increase reliability; watch for retests of the breakout level.

support_resistance_breakout_patterns.name: breakdown_below_support
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.look: Price moves and closes below a previously established support level.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.typical_context: After sideways trading or at end of a topping structure.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.notes: Increased selling volume often confirms; failed retests can accelerate the move.

support_resistance_breakout_patterns.name: false_breakout_fakeout
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.look: Price briefly breaks support or resistance then quickly reverses back into the prior range.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.typical_context: Around key levels after extended trends or crowded setups.
support_resistance_breakout_patterns.notes: Often traps late traders; can lead to strong moves in the opposite direction of the initial break.
